pull.title: [test] Qt: Use _putenv_s instead of setenv on Windows builds
pull.body:
Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/10836

Error message I would get on `make`:
```
...
  CXXLD    bench/bench_bitcoin.exe
  OBJCXXLD qt/bitcoin-qt.exe
qt/test/test_main.cpp: In function ‘int main(int, char**)’:
qt/test/test_main.cpp:64:43: error: ‘setenv’ was not declared in this scope
     setenv("QT_QPA_PLATFORM", "minimal", 0);
                                           ^
make[2]: *** [qt/test/qt_test_test_bitcoin_qt-test_main.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
make[2]: Leaving directory `/home/bmcmichael/Projects/bcoin/src'
make[1]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/bmcmichael/Projects/bcoin/src'
make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
```

`setenv` function is not available from the Microsoft runtime library. Need to use `_putenv_s` instead.

This solution tells the compiler to use `_putenv_s` on `WIN32` compilation (Note: this also works on 64-bit Windows instances.) and `setenv` everywhere else.

I've tested builds on Windows 10 x64 and Ubuntu 16.04 with this code.

events.message: Qt: Use _putenv_s instead of setenv on Windows builds

issue.title: Make on windows not working
issue.body:
1. Install Ubuntu for Windows [as stated in this post](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/build-windows.md)
2. Run
`~sudo apt-get install build-essential libtool autotools-dev automake pkg-config bsdmainutils curl
~sudo apt-get install g++-mingw-w64-x86-64 mingw-w64-x86-64-dev
~cd depends
~make HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32`
3. At the last command, it gives an error.

### Expected behaviour
The make command functioning properly

### Actual behaviour
The make throws an error.

### Screenshots.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14000942/28289094-44c60fda-6b39-11e7-82c7-e892b641d01c.png)


### What version of bitcoin-core are you using?
Commit no. 0b01935

### Machine specs:
PC:
- OS: Windows 10
- CPU: i7 6700
- RAM: 6GB
- SSD storing OS: 250GB
- HDD storing clone of this repo: 3TB

Laptop:
- OS: Windows 10
- CPU: i5 3210M
- RAM: 6GB
- Disk size: 250GB
- Disk Type: SSD

I ran this with both my computers, and the error was the same on both. The specs of each are listed above.

rename.from: Qt: Use _putenv_s instead of setenv on Windows builds
rename.to: [test] Qt: Use _putenv_s instead of setenv on Windows builds
